intro: Oenanthe fedtschenkoana, commonly known as the Fedtschenko's cow parsley, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its delicate white flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
